title: Trump expected to reveal new labor secretary nominee later on Thursday

organizations.name: florida international university college of law
environmental control and labor licensing regulation department

text:
President Donald Trump plans to reveal later on Thursday his new nominee for labor secretary, after myriad scandals scuttled the confirmation of his prior pick, fast-food CEO Andrew Puzder. Puzder withdrew his nomination on Wednesday, after POLITICO published a video in which his former wife leveled abuse allegations against him while appearing on Oprah's show in disguise in 1990. She later recanted the accusations.
Puzder also faced scrutiny for employing an undocumented worker and failing to pay taxes on her employment until after his nomination.
On the White House short list are Alexander Acosta, dean of Florida International University College of Law and a former Republican National Labor Relations Board member; Peter Kirsanow, also a former Republican NLRB member; and Catherine Templeton, who ran South Carolina’s Health and Environmental Control and Labor Licensing Regulation Department.
Another possibility is Joseph Guzman, a professor at Michigan State University’s human resources and labor department. Guzman met with Trump in January.
Madeline Conway contributed to this report.
